algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) starting from node 0, avoiding restricted nodes
problem_summary_simple: Count reachable nodes from node 0 in a tree, avoiding specific restricted nodes.
problem_summary_technical: Perform BFS from node 0, marking visited nodes and skipping restricted nodes and their subtrees.
key_insights: The problem is a standard graph traversal on a tree with node restrictions.
BFS is an efficient way to explore reachable nodes level by level.
A boolean array or set can efficiently track visited and restricted nodes.
